channel.title: Learning Java as first coding language?
channel.description:
I think the title really states my question; I want to dive into the world of programming and don't know if learning Java would be a comfortable place to start, or if I should try another language like Python etc etc.
Thank you in advance!

item.title: Learning Java as first coding language?
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“s1gma, post:9, topic:545749”][quote author=Death Style link=topic=664633.msg4444035#msg4444035 date=1407898711]
probably would give a better understanding of how pointers work and what they do in upper level languages where you don’t use them

one of my first mistakes was thinking that passing in an array to a function passed in a cloned one I could freely modify until I realized it was just a reference to the original
[/quote]

i still don’t feel as if pointers justify learning C first. you should acquire an understanding of reference vs. value using Java/Python anyway, and pointers are a mere expansion thereof. beginner motivation comes from results and eureka moments, and Python adequately facilitates not struggling to contend with pointers to blocks of memory just to say hi to yourself in the console.[/quote]
it personally took me awhile to fully grasp the concept behind references even after I had gotten relatively familiar with OOP

Read full topic
item.source: Learning Java as first coding language?

item.title: Learning Java as first coding language?
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“Death Style, post:6, topic:545749”]probably would give a better understanding of how pointers work and what they do in upper level languages where you don’t use them

one of my first mistakes was thinking that passing in an array to a function passed in a cloned one I could freely modify until I realized it was just a reference to the original[/quote]

i still don’t feel as if pointers justify learning C first. you should acquire an understanding of reference vs. value using Java/Python anyway, and pointers are a mere expansion thereof. beginner motivation comes from results and eureka moments, and Python adequately facilitates not struggling to contend with pointers to blocks of memory just to say hi to yourself in the console.

Read full topic

We were forced to learn C first. We’re only just moving on to java-based units.

item.source: Learning Java as first coding language?

item.title: Learning Java as first coding language?
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

Yz85Racer:

I learned Java first. It’s definitely not a bad choice to learn first, though in hindsight… if I could choose what I learned first, I would of chose C.

[sup][sup]*would have[/sup][/sup]

i’m curious: pourqoi? i’m last person to suggest it as a beginner language, but i guess there are some merits in starting at such a low level…

Read full topic

item.title: Learning Java as first coding language?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

I started in Java. I personally dont like those scripting languages like Python and Ruby because I dont like simple syntax. I find it best to learn Java first.

Read full topic

item.title: Learning Java as first coding language?
item.dc:creator: @Death_Style Death Style
item.description:
@Death_Style wrote:

java was the first I learned and I can’t stand it but it’s probably a good starter

they teach it after you learn python at my university though, so that’s also something to consider
